title: Minecraft Modpack Updates
info:
I've made some changes to all of our modpacks. My main goal here was to consolidate some of the packs to make it less confusing as to which one is which, and also to make them easier to maintain in the future. Below are the changes for each modpack.

Modded

Added Chisel, Fairy Lights, HWYLA, Iron Furnaces, MrCrayfish's Furniture Mod, OpenBlocks, PneumaticCraft, Tropicraft, and Waystones. Removed Secret Rooms Mod and Stargate Network.

Modded 2

Upgraded Minecraft version from 1.19.2 to 1.21.1 and changed the modloader from Fabric to NeoForge. The mod list was redone with both Modded 2 and Adventure in mind, so you'll see a lot of familiar mods but also a lot of new ones too based on community requests. Since this is a complete revamp, the save has also been regenerated.

Unbalanced

Added Better Builders Wands, BiblioCraft, Chisel, and OpenComputers. Removed Waystones and regenerated the save as well.

Unbalanced 2

This modpack has been removed. Some of its mods were moved to Modded 1 and Unbalanced 1. Much like the original Unbalanced 1, both the client and server have been archived in case we ever want to return to it.

Adventure

This modpack has also been removed and archived. Roughly half of its mods were moved to Modded 2.

title: Attention Windows 10 Users
info:
As you probably know, Microsoft is ending support for Windows 10 in less than 2 weeks. A lack of support means that after October 14, Windows 10 will stop receiving security updates indefinitely, which is likely going to lead to millions of devices becoming vulnerable to attack vectors that are found and never patched.

There is some good news, though. Microsoft isn't completely ending support for Windows 10. There are several different methods to obtain extended security updates that will continue to roll out for anywhere between 1 and 7 years, depending on the method chosen. For example, the commercial extended security program will last until 2028, and Windows 10 IoT Enterprise LTSC 2021 will continue to receive updates until 2032.

If you plan to continue using Windows 10, I highly recommend looking into enrolling in one of the extended security programs, or switching to one of the special Windows 10 versions that will continue to be updated. More information can be found here.

If you have any questions about this feel free to ask me. I know this isn't the type of announcement I typically make, but I feel like it's important to let people know what options they have, since Windows 10's EoL is a bit different from previous versions, and it could potentially have major security implications for millions of people.

(or....you could switch to Linux)

  • Updated to version 2.0 of the Universal Crafting System addon. This will make the system much easier to maintain in the future.

  • Cocaine can now be purified by any amount. Higher purification takes longer, costs more fuel, and makes the high last longer. Lower purification takes less time, and has a higher chance of having bad withdraw effects and making players instantly wanted when trying to sell it.
  • Replaced the meth stove and meth pot with meth mixer and meth oven entities. A wide variety of ingredients can be added to the mixer, each having their own unique effect. Some ingredients may cause only negative effects. 10 ingredients are required for the mixing process to start. The oven is used to bake the mixed ingredients into the final product. The oven requires fuel and constantly runs. Leaving cooked meth in the oven for too long will cause an explosion.
  • Replaced the two meth ingredients with one filler ingredient. At least one bottle of filler is required to make meth. Failing to add it will cause the mixer to explode. Adding too much filler will cause the smuggler to call the cops when trying to sell the meth.

title: Unbalanced 1 Refresh
info:
The Minecraft Unbalanced 1 server (from 2019) has been refreshed. I figured it was worth doing since we haven't played on it in about 4 years. The server and modpack now run on Minecraft version 1.7.10 instead of 1.12.2. I did this mainly for two reasons: We've never had a 1.7.10 server, and there's a lot of good mods that were never updated past this version. Some mods have stayed, but many more were added and removed. The full changelog is listed below. The original modpack and server (along with the map) have been archived in case we ever want to revisit it.

title: HLU RP Update 12/21
info:
Additions

  • Added an automated system to trigger the cascade on BMRP. When the survey team is mining crystals in Xen, there is a 10% chance of obtaining a pure crystal sample. These samples can be inserted into the AMS to trigger the cascade. There are currently two samples that correspond with the available City 17 RP maps. When the HECU detonates the nuke, the chosen City 17 RP map is no longer random and now depends on what sample was inserted into the AMS.
  • Added a loyalty system to City 17 RP that determines when citizens are allowed to perform certain actions. For example, citizens cannot have more than 90% loyalty to spawn the rebel crafting table, and cannot have more than 25% loyalty to become a Resistance Leader. Loyalty can be reduced by mining and killing Combine units, but the Combine can also force a citizen's loyalty to increase by beating them with stunsticks, killing them, or arresting them.
  • Added a cooldown when being demoted from a job so that players cannot immediately choose that job again.
  • Added GAuto. Vehicles can now run out of fuel and be destroyed, but not permanently. The Custodian on BMRP will now spawn with vehicle fuel and repair tools, and rebels on Outland RP can craft repair kits and fuel cans. Vehicles that spawn around the map on Outland RP will spawn with random health and fuel amounts.
  • Added a 1.5 hour time limit to Outland RP. If the rebels cannot launch their rocket or destroy the Combine base within this time period, the Combine will automatically win.
  • Added support for more boss events on rp_bmrf.
  • Added textscreens around rp_bmrf to make it easier to navigate, especially at tram stations.

Changes

  • Replaced Gman's teleporter with the Gman Teleporting Briefcase addon.
  • Moved the HECU Weapon Crate to the locked weapons room on rp_bmrf.
  • Replaced both Outland RP maps with rp_mezs. This is a fantastic map that fits with the server better than the other two.
  • Updated rp_city24_v3 to rp_city24_v4.
  • Merged the Weapons Engineer job into the Weapon Specialist job on BMRP. Due to this change, the Weapon Specialist has been moved to the Science category and will no longer spawn with weapons and ammo, but being able to spawn weapon shipments hasn't changed.
  • Renamed the Service Official to Custodian.
  • The Biochemist now spawns with the Possessor by default instead of having to craft it.
  • Vortigaunts will now be demoted back to Citizen when killed on City 17 RP.
  • The loading screen will now indicate and give a short explanation about what segment of the RP the server is currently playing on.
  • The Overwatch Soldier, Overwatch Guard, and Resistance Leader jobs are now restricted until at least 5 metrocops are killed. This was done to make the progression to more powerful units feel more natural.
  • Increased the time, range, and conditions for spawning loot around the map on Outland RP.
  • Replaced the portal closing button on Outland RP with a central core that the rebels must destroy to eliminate the Combine and end the session.
  • Manhacks on Outland RP are now deployable by Overwatch Soldiers instead of by all Combine units from an NPC.
  • Players will now automatically enter Combine vehicles when deploying them on Outland RP.
  • Combine vehicles will now automatically despawn after 5 minutes of inactivity on Outland RP.
  • Players will now be forced to respawn when switching teams on Outland RP to prevent abuse.
  • Changed the Combine Vehicle NPC to a Vehicle Deployment Terminal.
  • Improved the rebel rocket launch button to make it more noticeable.
  • Moved the Refugee to a separate category on Outland RP so it doesn't have access to the rebel buy menu.
  • Due to changes made to Outland RP, the gm_atomic map is now accessible from BMRP, but only under special conditions that allow for inserting a nuke into the AMS.
  • Reworked how events are handled on BMRP. The Gman can choose what event should trigger next, but can no longer trigger it directly. Events will be triggered by the server if the right conditions are met, and events that the Gman 'nudged' will take priority.
  • Improved the GUI for the item NPCs and buy menu.

Fixes

  • Fixed the Gman event menu on BMRP being completely broken.
  • Fixed the keys not being able to lock or unlock doors that were part of predefined groups.
  • Fixed the door system creating errors when trying to lock/unlock Level 2 Security doors on BMRP, due to it referencing a job that was removed a while ago.

Deletions

  • Removed rp_sectorc_beta and rp_city17_district47. They weren't necessarily needed and reducing the amount of maps makes it easier to manage the remaining ones.
  • Removed the ceasefire system from City 17 RP since the new loyalty system should naturally prevent rushing.

By default, these steroids will regenerate a player's health by 3 HP/sec for 10 minutes, but it has a rare chance of having the opposite effect. Combining weed with the steroid will cause players who consume it to turn into zombies. These zombies are highly infectious and can even transmit the infection for a short time after they're dead. Killing zombies with fire will kill the infection and make their corpses safe to approach.

  • Weed plants will now only grow if they are outside or under a heat lamp inside.
  • Weed plants can now be destroyed if they take too much damage.
  • Revamped the meth-making process. The two ingredients used to make meth can no longer be purchased at the contraband dealer. Instead, they are made in the same pot as meth itself. Press your use key on an empty pot to change what is being made.
  • Inserting chloride before sodium in a meth pot will now cause a violent chemical reaction with black smoke and a loud noise, and an explosion 15 seconds later.
  • The propane canister can once again be destroyed, but it will not start fires or explode.
  • Revamped the coke-making process. The perfect purity will now always be 30 minutes after putting the raw coke in the purifier. Over-purifying coke will cause it to lose most of its value. Under-purifying coke will yield better results but value will still be lost.
  • The purifier will now display a timer to show how long it has been running.
  • The purifier can now take damage and randomly catch fire while it is running.
  • Reduced all payouts for coke. (Possibly temporary, might need rebalanced once people start using it.)
  • Revamped money printers. There is now only a single printer, but it can receive several different upgrades including max paper increase, sound level decrease, overheat chance decrease, and output increase. Upgrades can be stacked for a greater effect, and all upgrades and paper amount will now save when a printer is inventoried.
  • The undercover officer can now commit the same high-level crimes as normal civilian jobs.
  • Selecting the undercover officer in the F4 menu will now silently change your job without alerting anyone else or updating your job name on the scoreboard.
  • The handheld metal detector will now detect less police-specific items such as the confiscation and evidence tools. This will make it easier for you to keep your cover as undercover officer.
  • The shooter and bank robber NPCs will now spawn with random arc9 weapons and have a longer attack range.
  • Corpses of shooter and bank robber NPCs will now fade away after a short time.
  • Refined ores including diamond, gold, and ruby can now be inventoried.
  • Iron is now stackable in the inventory.

Deletions:

  • Removed the spider drone from the crafting table.
  • Removed the !undercover chat command as the new changes to the job make it redundant.

title: CityRP Update 6/27
info:
Changes:

  • The mayor and all police jobs can now be tased, cuffed, and arrested like a regular civilian.
  • Replaced the taser with a better version that shoots physical wires. This version also uses ammo that can be obtained from ammo lockers. Non-police will need to break into the locker with a taser in their weapon slots to get ammo for it. The contraband version of the taser is no longer single-use due to the ammo addition.
  • The banker can now hand out loans to players through the same computer that they use to manage deposit boxes. Loans do not have any interest, even if payments are missed, and do not affect the city economy. Payments are automatically done every 5 minutes assuming the loaner can afford it, and debts are saved between sessions.
  • Players can no longer take out loans through ATMs. Any debts you may have had with the ATM loan system will not be transferred over to the new system.
  • The speed radar will now also give police officers the name of the car that sped past, instead of just the name of the driver.
  • Increased the strength of the rope leash to be the same as the shackles.
  • Enabled blindfolding and gagging on both leashes, and disabled the abilities on the shackles.
  • Adjusted the depths, prices, and catch times for all fish.
  • When fishing, there is no longer a progress bar with a set time until a fish bites. Bites now happen at random times and depend on the type of fish being caught.
  • Reduced the capacity of the medium fish cage from 10 to 8.
  • The ichthyosaur no longer randomly spawns when someone catches a fish.
  • Players can now only be revived 3 times in a single life. This prevents infinite death loops and removes the need for the rule relating to it.
  • Wanted text will no longer appear above player's heads, making it easier to hide.

Deletions:

  • Removed the handheld speed radar. If you wish to clock a player's speed while sitting in a police car, you can press O to bring up the Photon radar.
  • Removed the car evictor. It was redundant for police jobs as the battering ram does the same thing. The battering ram will soon be added to the contraband dealer to fill the gap for civilians.

title: CityRP Update 3/12
info:
Additions:

  • Added flatbed tow truck that the mechanic can use for larger vehicles that the normal tow truck may not be able to handle.
  • Added world and view models to the mechanic's tow attach weapon.

Fixes:

  • Fixed an exploit with the fine system that allowed a player's money to go negative if they couldn't afford the fine. (Thanks to Rorkh on Github for this fix.)

Deletions:

  • Removed the EMS crown vic from the firefighter NPC.

title: HLU RP Update 2/28
info:
Additions:

  • Added /name and /job chat commands that allow players to customize their name and role. Custom names are saved between sessions.
  • Added truck that players can use to 'escape' the facility during the cascade on BMRP. When players 'escape', they will join the HECU as either a marine or captain, depending on whether or not there is already a captain. Players will not be forced to remain as HECU, and can switch to a different role at any time.
  • Added fire extinguisher cases around all BMRP maps. Players can use these cases to obtain a fire extinguisher in emergency situations. The service official can restock cases by purchasing a fire extinguisher from the F4 menu and touching it with an empty case.
  • Added rubble that spawns during the cascade on BMRP. The rubble blocks access to high-traffic areas around the facility, and can only be removed by mining it with a pickaxe or blowing it up with explosives.
  • Added zombie serum to BMRP that the biochemist can craft. Players who consume this serum will instantly turn into zombies, and cannot be turned back unless killed.

Changes:

  • Players can no longer pickup weapons that they already have. This will prevent unintentional pickups when crafting or buying weapons.
  • Replaced the door failure event on BMRP with a tram failure. This event will now also activate during the cascade. The service official will still be able to resume tram operation by fixing the generator during the cascade.
  • Players who are killed by any type of headcrab will now turn into zombies.

Deletions:

  • Removed rp_blackmesa_complex and rp_blackmesa_laboratory maps.

title: CityRP Update 2/26
info:
Additions:

  • Added Automod support to the new courier truck.

Changes:

  • When using an ammo locker, players will now directly receive the ammo instead of having it spawn in front of the locker. This will prevent people from taking ammo that someone else paid for.
  • Replaced the dump truck with the batmobile as the million dollar vehicle. It's sad to see it go but it was never practical due to its size. Players who owned the dump truck will receive the batmobile for free.
  • Job-specific vehicles such as police cars, fire trucks, and tow trucks will now be automatically removed when their owner disconnects or changes jobs.
  • Job-specific vehicles are now limited to 3 per player. If a player tries to spawn a 4th without removing at least one first, the last vehicle to be spawned will be removed.

Fixes:

  • Fixed the courier truck not showing up in the regular car dealer menu.
  • Fixed players not being able to buy sniper ammo from ammo lockers.
  • Fixed players being able to inventory items that were saved to a property.
  • Fixed money printers still trying to print after being removed.
  • Fixed mining carts spamming script errors when looking at them.
  • Fixed the menu for certain shop NPCs sometimes erroring when opened.

Deletions:

  • Removed the police Ford Explorer. It was redundant, didn't have a civilian version, and had so many lights it would cause the game to lag, so there was little reason to keep it around.

title: CityRP Update 2/21
info:
Additions:

  • Added evidence confiscation system. This system will allow police to use an item called an evidence wand to send contraband items to an evidence locker located in a secure part of PD for processing or safekeeping. The locker can be accessed by anyone, including civilians.

Changes:

  • Combined the PD bank with the regular bank. Certain mechanics have been taken from both systems. Leaving the area will stop the robbery. Money bags will spawn every 2 minutes. The bags must be cashed in at the banker NPC after the robbery. Up to $20,000 can be taken during a robbery. After a robbery attempt, the bank cannot be robbed again for an hour. The bank can now also be robbed with only 1 cop on the server as long as there is also a banker on the server.
  • The city bank and mayor fund values are now the same, which means robbing the bank will have a negative impact on the city's balance. Along with this, the city now has the ability to make and spend money in multiple ways. The city can make money by increasing income, sales, and/or property taxes. The city can lose money by having the mayor buy things from the catalog such as extra weapons for police. The mayor can also set perks mentioned below that can increase or decrease the city's income depending on what they do.
  • Government and police jobs now receive paychecks from the city bank. This means that if the city bank value gets too low, these jobs will not receive any paychecks.
  • Eco points now update based on the city's current income and how much is in the bank. The mayor no longer has to manage them separately.
  • Replaced the mayor's random event system with a perk system that is accessed through the mayor menu. The mayor can activate perks to change certain aspects of the economy and the city in general. Some perks increase the city's income but has a negative consequence, while other perks decrease the city's income but make a positive change. Perks can be changed at any time, but only 3 can be active at once. If the mayor dies, leaves the server, or changes jobs, any active perks will be reset.
  • Replaced Stormfox 2 with Atmos for performance reasons.
  • Replaced the ArcCW weapon system with Arc9 and a very similar weapon pack. Most of the guns people had in their inventories will remain unchanged, and a lot of new guns have been added. All of the crafting, gun dealer, and supermarket prices for these weapons have been rebalanced.
  • Players can no longer refill the fuel tank of their personal vehicle by respawning it.
  • Improved the look of the death screen.
  • Life alert will now also activate when a player takes damage, and it will now specify to cops and firefighters what caused the alert to activate. (Injury, death, or manual alert)
  • Players will now be warned twice about not being able to afford property taxes before all of their properties are taken away.
  • Taking jobs from the job broker no longer costs money.
  • Money that players lose on death is now dropped near their body.
  • Firefighters will now only be rewarded for the house fire event if they are within the range of where the fire started, and cops will now only be rewarded for the drunk driver event if they are within range of where the driver was stopped.

Deletions:

  • Removed the !fixeco chat command since eco points no longer need to be directly managed by the mayor.
  • Removed Seat Weaponizer 2. It was causing microstuttering and the sit anywhere script allows players to use weapons anyway.

title: CityRP Update 12/27
info:
Additions:

  • Added the rock decimator. This is a gun that shoots a powerful beam that instantly mines rocks by destroying them. It can be bought from the supermarket and crafted and can be used 3 times before it is destroyed.
  • Added a gun dealer job. It is a civilian job that has the ability to sell weapons through custom shipments, as well as craft weapons at a reduced cost. The custom shipments allow the gun dealer to sell up to 10 of any gun that is available to craft or buy at the supermarket.
  • Added simple day/night cycle that switches between 12:00 AM and 12:00 PM every 30 minutes. This is being used instead of Stormfox's built-in system to reduce the amount of times the game freezes due to having to recalculate light maps.
  • Added label above the car dealer NPC so it's easier to find.
  • Added RTX 4090 explosive device that acts like a stick of dynamite. Interacting with it will set it on fire and after a few seconds it will explode.

Changes:

  • Combined the mayor fire menu with the normal mayor menu.
  • Revamped the default laws on the website to only list what players can't do, rather than what they can and can't do.
  • Due to the removal of the IA Agent, voting to remove the mayor from office can now be initiated by any citizen.
  • Reduced the salaries for most jobs.
  • Removed the crafting blueprint requirement for all guns except the LMG. (All explosives still require blueprints.)
  • The smelter can now duplicate iron for $50 each. To do this, place iron owned by you near the smelter and press your use key on it.
  • Replaced the graffiti SWEP with a newer and improved version from the workshop.
  • Cooked fish now restores full hunger and health.
  • The cook now gets a discount on farm products at the supermarket.
  • The microwave can no longer be stored in inventories.
  • Revamped the cook's moonshine system to use farm food as ingredients instead of its own set of food, and made each drink have its own special effects.
  • Merged the writable book with the money printer paper, and moved the money printer paper from the contraband dealer to the supermarket.
  • When buying gas from the pump, players will now only be charged for the amount they need, instead of paying $300 every time.
  • Increased walk and run speed when using cocaine.
  • Merged the smuggle system with the job broker. Items to deliver are now worth the same and are selected at random, but everything else remains unchanged.
  • Replaced semi trucks with the courier truck from the TDM commercial vehicle pack.
  • Moved the news TV to the supermarket. It can also now be inventoried.
  • The news cameraman will now only receive profits for news TVs that are not owned by him and are tuned to his channel.
  • Players can no longer save vehicles on properties. (This is temporary until I figure out a good solution to save owned vehicles but not temporary vehicles such as police cars and tow trucks.)
  • The shooter event now only rewards players who deal damage to the NPC.

Fixes:

  • Fixed farm plants not growing when receiving sunlight.
  • Fixed certain farm plants not spawning properly when planted.

Deletions:

  • Removed the IA Agent job.
  • Removed the Dodge Ram 3500 utility truck from the car dealer.

title: HLU RP Update 12/20
info:
Additions:

  • Added viewmodel to broom.
  • Added cascade function for rp_bmrf. (Manually activated for now, might try to tie it to the AMS at some point.)
  • Added noise that plays when messages are displayed in text chat.

Changes:

  • Players can no longer become resistance leaders on City 17 RP until the ceasefire is over.
  • Refugees and Combine jobs can no longer use the rebel item shop, and refugees and rebel jobs can no longer use the Combine vehicle shop on Outland RP.
  • The scientist no longer spawns in Combine captivity on City 17 RP.
  • The scientist can no longer detonate the citadel directly. Instead, he needs to first craft a locker key to give to the rebels, so that they can craft a code decrypter to be used on the detonation console.
  • Cancelling an active detonation or launch on City 17 RP or Outland RP is now done through the original console it was initiated on, instead of a separate cancellation button nearby.

Fixes:

  • Fixed OOC chat not working.
  • Fixed script errors sometimes appearing when people left the server.
  • Fixed players not being able to spawn the rebel crafting table on City 17 RP.
  • Fixed players not being able to spawn items from the rebel item shop on Outland RP.
  • Fixed sentries targeting friendlies on City 17 RP and Outland RP.
  • Fixed script errors appearing when players tried to use the keys or battering ram on invalid entities.

title: CityRP Update 11/12
info:
Additions:

  • Added a custom property system. Details will eventually be on the website, but you can ask me about it in the meantime. The main features are that each building or apartment is now ownable. You don't have to buy individual doors anymore, and they will remain owned by you even if you disconnect. You can also save entities on owned properties for later sessions through the context menu.

Changes:

  • Cops can now choose what type of sentence they want a criminal to serve when arrested. A reduced sentence automatically releases the prisoner after 5 minutes, while a full sentence does not automatically release the prisoner. This is intended to make it easier for cops to manually arrest someone without having to physically walk them into jail.
  • Money printers will now always have a 30 second delay before exploding when overheating, instead of a random number between 10 and 30 seconds.
  • Your position will now be saved when disconnecting.
  • Lock picking times now depend on the price of the property the door belongs to, meaning more expensive properties take longer to break into. If the door doesn't belong to a property, it will take 30 seconds to pick.
  • Replaced the bot in the drunk driver event with the reckless Dr. Kleiner NPC. In order to stop him, you now need to stop the vehicle from moving and press your use key on it. You don't have to use the car evictor and cuff the driver anymore.

title: CityRP Update 10/2
info:
Changes:

  • The confiscation tool now displays a menu that allows cops to manually select what items to take. Items are also now given to the cop instead of being stored in the tool itself.
  • Players must now be cuffed to confiscate weapons from them.
  • The bus passenger event has been revamped to be much more in-depth. Bus drivers now pickup multiple NPCs at bus stops around the map and take them to a central location. NPCs will automatically board when the bus is in range and has come to a complete stop.
  • Revamped the food delivery event to make the cook deliver to existing NPCs around the map instead of a separate one that spawns at a random location.
  • Names once again appear above players' heads.
  • Players can now move while changing disguises so they have a chance to escape if their cover is blown.
  • Selling drugs as a civilian no longer has a chance to make you wanted.
  • Selling drugs as a gov or cop job will now activate a 10 minute cooldown.
  • The drug NPC will now teleport between 4 different locations every 30 minutes to prevent camping abuse from both cops and civilians.
  • Merged marketable and consumable drugs. To consume any drug now, you can press your use key on it. To sell any drug, you can press your use key on the drug NPC. The drug NPC will also now accept multiple drugs per use.
  • Moved the purifier to the contraband NPC. Since marketable weed is no longer a thing, the purifier only has the ability to purify cocaine now, and thus doesn't need to be a public entity anymore.
  • Reduced the selling price of weed from 500 to 300 due to the aforementioned changes.
  • The handheld metal detector will now display the illegal item's actual name instead of its entity name.
  • Spinach pizza no longer requires sauce as an ingredient.
  • Mayors who have been voted out of office will now be banned from entering elections for 30 minutes.
  • Turned the built-in prop protection back on and adjusted the physgun protection so people can't grab each other's junk anymore.
  • The money transfer event now requires the banker to deliver the check to the deposit boxes due to the check machine's removal.

Fixes:

  • Fixed players being able to find a gun that no longer exists as rare loot from dumpsters.
  • Fixed players being able to gravgun dumpsters and deposit box computers.
  • Fixed the ichthyosaur not being able to spawn on rp_southside_day.

Deletions:

  • Removed the chat commands related to changing and showing your identity. (A revamp of the undercover officer job is planned.)
  • Removed rp_florida_v2 and rp_newexton2_v4h. (Due to the nature of the upcoming property system it was necessary to let go of some maps. I may add one more back at some point.)
  • Removed the SWAT hummer. (It was hardly used and pretty redundant since the bearcat is better in almost every way.)
  • Removed the check machine. (Only used once or twice in the 4 or 5 years its been on the server, and there are plenty of other ways of getting $2,000 for emergency situations.)

title: CityRP Update 9/21
info:
This is part 1 of a major rework update for CityRP.

Additions:

  • Added the rock scanner. It allows players to view the contents of rocks before mining. It can be bought at the supermarket.
  • Added tile build and primitive tools.
  • Added fire hose nodes that allow players to extend the hose range of their fire truck.

Changes:

  • Combined ore and iron rocks into a single entity. Spawns have remained the same. There are 5 tiers of rarity rocks can spawn with. The rarer it is, the higher amount of iron it will produce.
  • Rocks no longer always take 10 hits to mine, the number now depends on how much iron the rock contains.
  • Merged the ore smelter with the iron refiner. The iron refiner can now also process 3 things at once.
  • Random events are no longer random. They can instead be bought for a fee at a new NPC called the job broker. This NPC is located at the front desk of city hall on every map. Each event or job gives a reward to the person who completed it. Multiple events involving the same jobs cannot be active at once.
  • Replaced the SWAT jobs with a locker located at the PD armory on each map. This locker allows police officers to change into SWAT gear while saving their current gear in the locker. While on duty as SWAT, players walk slower and cannot use certain NPCs.
  • The citizen job no longer receives a $60 paycheck as they are considered unemployed/freelance/contractors.
  • Changed the slots of certain weapons so they don't all use the same slot and are easier to retrieve.
  • Moved car bomb protection from the supermarket to the mechanic's F4 buy menu.
  • Improved the car bomb explosion effect. The explosion is louder and now sends the car flying into the air.
  • Vehicles blown up by car bombs now get automatically removed after 10 minutes.
  • Changed the police radio keyup sound to be more realistic and play in 3D space so other people know when an officer is talking on the radio and not to them.
  • Increased the size of particles for the fire hose to make them easier to see when fighting large fires.
  • Renamed the ER Commander to Fire Chief and renamed the Emergency Responder to Firefighter.
  • The axe can now break open doors when used by firefighters.
  • Emergency responder jobs will no longer take burn damage.
  • Players now have to press their use key on hitmen to place a hit instead of using a chat command.
  • Hitmen can no longer see their target on the HUD. They will now have to verify they have the right guy before going in for the kill.
  • The mechanic now rents out semi trucks and trailers instead of an NPC doing it.
  • When a dump truck spawns, only players within the spawn zone will be notified now when the truck is about to spawn.

Fixes:

  • Fixed emergency responders being able to use the fire hose anywhere even if a fire truck isn't nearby.
  • Fixed the firefighter NPC spawning in the wrong place on certain maps.
  • Fixed grenades not being able to be thrown.
  • Fixed the money transfer event not rewarding players with a tier 2 blueprint.

Deletions:

  • Removed the courier NPC and related entities. (Replaced by the job broker)

title: CityRP Update 7/18
info:
Additions:

  • Added life insurance item to the healer NPC. When a player has life insurance, they will not lose money when they die for the rest of the session.

Changes:

  • Merged the firefighter and paramedic NPCs into one. Fire trucks and ambulances are now both spawned at the fire station.

Fixes:

  • Fixed players not being able to cash in stolen deposit box money bags.
  • Fixed players losing money on death during a purge, and not losing money on death during a lockdown.

Deletions:

  • Removed announcement system. (Same reason it was removed from HLU RP, broken and not very useful to begin with.)

title: HLU RP Update 7/14
info:
Additions:

  • Added task system for BMRP. The facility administrator can assign tasks to different jobs by pressing F1. Tasks can either be set from a predefined list, or manually set with custom text. Players can see their current task in the upper left corner, similar to DarkRP agendas.
  • Added keybindings and chat commands page to the website.

Changes:

  • Improved the look of the playermodel selector and scoreboard.
  • Revamped the BMRP event system. It is no longer random and instead controlled by the government man through a menu that can be accessed by pressing F1. The events themselves are mostly the same as before, any changes will be listed below.
  • Revamped the BMRP budget system. Players once again have control over their own money. Funds can be obtained by completing events and tasks, and selling unused materials and equipment. Funds can be spent on things in the new buy menu.
  • Survey members are now fully immune to radiation damage, and biochemists now have radiation damage reduced by 50%.
  • Radioactive crafting materials can no longer be transported in player's pockets, and now need to be transported in radioactive material containers, which the biochemist can purchase.
  • The medic revive event now causes a player to faint instead of an NPC.
  • Fires will now slowly fade out on City 17 RP and Outland RP, but will slowly grow until extinguished on BMRP.
  • Reduced the health of bosses for the boss fight event to 1000 HP.
  • Entities that are mined and crafted will now be owned by the player who obtained it. This will prevent certain prop protection issues from occurring.

Fixes:

  • Fixed certain radioactive crafting materials causing much more radiation damage than they should.

Deletions:

  • Removed automated vox announcements from rp_bmrf to prevent players from thinking the announcements came from the facility administrator.
  • Removed voice announcement system. (It never worked right and isn't that necessary to begin with.)

title: CityRP Update 7/13
info:
Fixes:

  • Fixed drones immediately breaking when spawned by the shop NPC.
  • Fixed molotovs not spawning when bought from the contraband NPC or found while dumpster diving.
  • Fixed potholes spawning above the ground.

title: HLU RP Update 7/5
info:
Additions:

  • Added /y (yell) and /w (whisper) chat commands.
  • Added the buy menu back. This eliminates the need for item shops on BMRP and City 17 RP, as well as pre-spawned crafting tables on City 17 RP. All players can access the menu at any time by pressing F3.
  • Added Falco's Prop Protection back.

Changes:

  • Voice chat is now 3D, meaning voice will emit from the speaking player and will get quieter as distance from them increases.
  • Certain HL1 weapons now use HL2 ammo for better compatibility with the ammo locker.
  • Scoreboard text will now change to white if the background color is too dark to read black text.
  • Reworked the job selection menu to make it much neater. Descriptions can now be accessed by clicking the question mark on the right side of each job, and playermodels can be selected by clicking the model icon on the left side of each job.
  • Updated rp_city24_v2 to rp_city24_v3.
  • The forklifts on BMRP are now restricted to service officials and cannot be used by any other job.
  • Slightly decreased jumping power.
  • Xen NPCs on BMRP will now automatically respawn 10 minutes after the last one is killed.
  • Headcrabs will no longer spawn in Xen on BMRP since bullsquids tend to kill them immediately after spawning.
  • Player expressions will now take effect immediately after changing jobs and no longer require a respawn.
  • The scientist on City 17 RP can now spawn the combine crafting table and no longer requires the earth admin to do it for them.
  • The overwatch guard can now spawn the same medical items as the rebel medic on Outland RP.
  • The facility administrator will now be notified of any purchases that use the facility budget on BMRP.
  • The technician can now buy the GTerminal Wiremod I/O device on BMRP.

Fixes:

  • Fixed service official being able to throw away blacklisted items on BMRP.
  • Fixed government man not spawning with his teleporter.
  • Fixed the service official's broom not clearing decals on BMRP.
  • Fixed the head of security on BMRP and the resistance leader on City 17 RP not spawning with enough ammo.
  • Fixed overwatch and preset vox announcements not playing.
  • Fixed player expressions not working with newer playermodels.
  • Rewrote gman's teleporter from scratch to fix a bunch of problems it had.
  • Fixed view model hands not changing.

Deletions:

  • Removed research and development job from BMRP. (Job was redundant. The few exclusive items it had were absorbed into the rest of the science jobs.)

title: CityRP Update 5/28
info:
Additions:

  • Added !discord chat command that displays the link to the Lambda Gaming Discord.

Changes:

  • Adjusted global StormFox settings for better optimization.
  • Replaced rp_southside with its daytime version for better StormFox compatibility.
  • Players now have to wait 30 seconds after selecting the dump truck at the car dealer for it to spawn. This will give players time to clear the truck's spawning area. This also prevents multiple players from spawning the dump truck at the same time.

title: HLU RP Update 5/27
info:
Additions:

  • Added !discord chat command that links to the Lambda Gaming Discord.

Changes:

  • Preset vox and overwatch announcement chat commands are now called differently. The new format is !announce [keyword]. See the website for more info.
  • Increased the cooldown for vox and overwatch chat commands from 5 seconds to 10.
  • The vox chat and console command is now available for the facility administrator and is no longer exclusive to server admins.

title: HLU RP Update 10/24
info:
Fixes:

  • Fixed players not being able to pocket heavy objects even if they were whitelisted.
  • Fixed crystals instantly respawning after being mined on BMRP.
  • Fixed players not being able to release cuffed players.

title: HLU RP Update 10/23
info:
Additions:

  • Added gamemode logo for the main menu.

Changes:

  • Players who change their job from scientist on City 17 RP will now respawn at the default map spawn to prevent them from potentially getting stuck in the citadel.
  • Clicking a player's name on the scoreboard will now take you to their Steam profile.
  • The BMRP nuke will now turn on the facility alarm when activated.

Fixes:

  • Fixed the Combine door authenticator having two hand models.

title: CityRP Update 10/10
info:
Changes:

  • Players will now enter the drivers seat of vehicles if it is available, even if there are passenger seats that are closer to the player.

Fixes:

  • Fixed the parade and purge not ending if the mayor left the server after activating them.

title: CityRP Update 10/3
info:
Changes:

  • Adjusted some accessories so they don't clip through certain playermodels.
  • Adjusted StormFox settings to improve performance and night lighting.
  • Weapon attachments will no longer reset on death.

Fixes:

  • Fixed the purifier almost instantly purifying weed and playing sounds when it shouldn't be.
  • Fixed supermarket NPC spawning broken blueprints.
  • Fixed rock and tree grinders sometimes spawning money in the wrong place.
  • Fixed Chevy Impala police not spawning with Photon support.
  • Fixed Dodge Monaco police spawning with an extra light bar.
  • Fixed the power failure mayor event not displaying properly if the first option was chosen.
  • Fixed BH Accessories creating script errors when a player hovered over the ghastly gibus in the accessory menu.

title: Happy 5th Anniversary!
info: Hard to believe, but Lambda Gaming is 5 years old today. I'd like to give a special thanks to everyone who has stuck with us up to this point, even through the gaps of inactivity. This is probably the biggest update I've ever done for this server. Not only was the server completely taken off of DarkRP, but a lot of the mechanics for each section were revamped. The changelog is below. Note that anything that was replaced due to the removal of DarkRP that didn't have it's function changed isn't listed here.

Additions:

  • [BMRP] Since money was removed with DarkRP, players will now have to keep track of a facility-wide budget that can be used with a new item shop to buy equipment. The budget can be seen at the top of the HUD. Completing random events and selling mined Xen materials to the budget NPC can increase the budget. If the budget gets too low, the facility administrator can use the budget NPC to take out a loan or sell previously bought equipment.
  • [BMRP] The item shop mentioned above sells everything that was previously in the F4 menu of certain jobs, including GTerminals, weapon crates, and lab equipment. 3-6 of these shops spawn on the map to reduce the amount of walking players have to do.
  • [BMRP] Added teleport sound when new NPCs spawn in Xen to alert players of the refresh.
  • Added rp_bmrf to BMRP. (We might use this as our new primary map if people like it more than rp_sectorc_beta. The map will still be used for Cascade.)
  • [BMRP] Added vehicle spawns to maps that allow vehicles to be used practically. (This currently includes rp_sectorc_beta, rp_bmrf, and gm_atomic.)
  • [BMRP] Added VOX alert message to the nuke event.
  • [BMRP] Added forklift spawns to each map for the service official to use.
  • [BMRP] Added ammo lockers to security and military posts on each map.
  • [BMRP] Added geiger counter sound to the radioactive lab materials so players know when to step away.
  • [City 17 RP] Added ammo lockers to the citadel armory on each map.
  • [City 17 RP] Added combine weapon dispensary that can be used to purchase the combine crafting table, weapon crates, and medical supplies.
  • [City 17 RP] Added 3 APC spawns to rp_city24_v2.

Changes:

  • Took the server off of DarkRP. This allows for much more flexibility and new features that will hopefully come from suggestions once we play a few sessions.
  • Changed the website button to F3. The link will now open in your steam overlay instead of an in-game HTML element.
  • Replaced handcuffs with the leash for better control over players. The time it takes to cuff a player is also much lower.
  • Lightened the restrictions on certain Wiremod tools. Most tools are no longer restricted to certain teams besides ones that can directly deal damage.
  • Admins can no longer spawn vehicles.
  • Merged the ammo lockers into one universal locker that will produce ammo based on the gun you are holding.
  • Restricted chat radio to BMRP only.

title: The Future of Lambda Gaming (Again)
info:
Happy new year to everyone. I'd like to talk about what's to come with this community in the future. I talked about this already back in April, but things have changed since then and I ended up going against all or most of my statements anyway, so let me try this again. I'll put a TL;DR at the end of large paragraphs for those who just want the basics.

First off, my college schedules have been very nice, a lot better than I expected. This has allowed me, and will continue to allow me (at least until this fall), to be more available to host servers.

As you've probably noticed, I haven't been hosting as much as I probably can with my free time. This is mainly due to the amount of projects i'm currently working on, which take priority over hosting in certain situations. The other factor, at least for the RP servers, is the lack of interest by the community. It's not everyone obviously but it seems to me that a good chunk of the regular playerbase has lost interest in joining those servers. If there's a particular reason for this, let me know and i'll try my best to fix it. Finding a decent amount of players to keep the RP going for over an hour is hard to come by these days and i'd love to go back to the good old days of averaging 6-7 players per session with the session lasting a good 5-6 hours.

(TL;DR: The two biggest reasons for a lack of sessions recently is because I'm working on projects that take up a lot of my free time and a big chunk of regulars have seemingly lost interest in the servers.)

Next, regarding servers going 24/7. I've said this many times now but let me reiterate: even if I came up with the money to host servers 24/7, time is still a huge factor. A lot of time would be required to convert the RP servers (which is assumed to be the ones to ever go 24/7 because of their popularity) into servers that can support a large, consistent playerbase because over the years a lot of systems and rules have been downgraded to suit our low playerbase better. This doesn't even include the time I would need to create forums, look at ban requests/appeals, and keep systems up to date to prevent exploits that would likely surface with a larger playerbase. So, to put it simply, don't expect 24/7 servers to ever happen from me.

(TL;DR: Don't expect 24/7 servers to ever happen from me.)

Regarding new servers and server updates, I'm honestly just all over the place with them at the moment. If someone has a really good idea for a server that I think could work, i'll probably at least try it. With major server updates, they usually start out as small content additions but grow into a huge update when I get more ideas and suggestions for stuff while also finding obscure bugs to fix. The way I treat these could change at any time in the future, I really don't know.

(TL;DR: I make new servers and release major updates for existing servers as good suggestions come to me, but this could change at any time.)

To conclude, I plan on staying here as long as I have the time to do so. It's probably too early to tell when I won't have time anymore. It's possible that it might be never. It depends on a lot of factors. I know some people have offered to take over the community for me but i'm still indecisive on that. For now though, i'll try to keep hosting servers and keep the community alive for as long as I can.

If anyone has any questions, comments, or concerns feel free to leave them in the comment section of this announcement or steam chat me.

info:
Crime RP and Simple DarkR.....I mean Boneless RP are being merged together to create a whole new server, which is currently being called Chaos RP. title: HLU RP Server Update 9/10
info:
This is update 4/4 of the HLU RP revamp. This update focuses on the new BMRP:Cascade gamemode, as well as a few tweaks involving money.

  • Added BMRP:Cascade gamemode. (See below for details.)
  • Replaced rp_lambdacore_fixed with rp_bmrf.

  • Added command that resets all wallets back to 3000. (Yes, money will be reset at the beginning of every session from now on, whether you are on the server or not. This was done so making money in the BMRP gamemodes is important so you can afford the big boi toys later on in City 17 RP and Outland RP.)
  • Added page to website that explains how to make money throughout the RPs.

BMRP:Cascade Details:

  • Game starts at the beginning of the cascade, no gameplay before that. The gamemode itself is built on top of DarkRP, but you may find that it plays similar to Breach.
  • Game takes place on rp_bmrf, the newest and biggest BMRP map currently on the workshop.
  • Players can play as friendly vortigaunts if player count is high. (Goes against lore but could give extra players something to do.)
  • Due to an automated round-start mechanic being not yet implemented, a superadmin will start the round after players have chosen their jobs and the jobs have been balanced out.
  • Scientists are allowed to build limited objects with the dupe tool. (Dupe tool could be abused, scientists could become op. Props will be severely limited.)
  • Players are allowed to become traitors to their coworkers. (Such as HECU joining the security force or the scientists joining the HECU, but if it starts to become repetitive every round players may be asked to stop.)
  • Scientists get released first in the pre-round to build, similar to Class Ds.
  • Security and scientists work together, they can take medics hostage for free healing.
  • Facility administrator is to kill everyone on sight while trying to escape.
  • HECU is to escort medics out while killing everyone else.
  • Medics are to work with HECU to escape while trying to avoid being captured by scientists or security.
  • Vortigaunts are to help players kill aliens and zombies.
  • Zombies are to kill everyone but their own kind.
  • Certain items will randomly spawn each round in specific spots. Ex: Special prototype weapons only spawn in science labs, and armor only spawns in locker rooms.
  • Players will get rewarded for escaping the facility and killing enemy players. (Escaping reward does not apply to HECU.)
  • The facility administrator is rewarded by how many kills he has gotten throughout the round.
  • Players killed by headcrabs will become zombies.
  • If zombies are equal to or are greater than the number of human players, all human players are allowed to team up, no matter what team they are on.
  • Since its impossible to randomise the layout of the map, random obstructions will spawn at the most common access points so players are forced to not use the same route every round. For example, concrete might fall from the ceiling at a tram station, blocking players from accessing the tram from that specific sector.
  • A tram controller will spawn at a random location and will have the trams disabled by default. Since all of the sectors are connected to each other through some other access point, the trams arent vital to gameplay and are only there to speed up the escape process. Players will have to press their use key on the controller to start the trams back up.
  • PM chat is disabled, players have to rely on local chat and g-terminals to get private messages across. Radios can work as well but they have a risk of someone listening in, even if the signal is weak.
  • HECU and security will spawn with random weapons to add variety.
  • Players can obtain fire extinguishers by pressing their use key on wall-mounted cases. They can then use the extinguishers to clear fire obstructions. (All fires have to be cleared before the obstruction is cleared, players cannot walk through the fire like in BMRP:Classic.)
  • The escape vehicle spawns at a random location topside. Players have to press their use key on it to escape.
  • Most doors in the map are locked when the round starts. Security and HECU are equipped with battering rams to get past these locked doors.
  • The server will be password locked for community members only while this gamemode is running until I feel comfortable enough to run it with randoms.

If you have any questions feel free to ask me. I'm planning on having a test session for the new gamemode either this coming Friday or Sunday. I may add a few more minor features to the gamemode before the first test run, depending on what i'm doing for the rest of the week.
